entries.name: ABBR_DAYNAMES
entries.desc:
An array of strings of abbreviated day names in English.  The first is
“Sun”.

entries.name: ABBR_MONTHNAMES
entries.desc:
An array of strings of abbreviated month names in English.  The first
element is nil.

entries.name: DAYNAMES
entries.desc:
An array of strings of the full names of days of the week in English. The
first is “Sunday”.

entries.name: ENGLAND
entries.desc:
The Julian day number of the day of calendar reform for England and her
colonies.

entries.name: GREGORIAN
entries.desc:
The Julian day number of the day of calendar reform for the proleptic
Gregorian calendar.

entries.name: ITALY
entries.desc:
The Julian day number of the day of calendar reform for Italy and some
catholic countries.

entries.name: JULIAN
entries.desc:
The Julian day number of the day of calendar reform for the proleptic
Julian calendar.

entries.name: MONTHNAMES
entries.desc:
An array of strings of full month names in English.  The first element is
nil.

entries.name: _httpdate(string)  →  hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a hash of parsed elements.

entries.name: _iso8601(string)  →  hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a hash of parsed elements.

entries.name: _jisx0301(string)  →  hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a hash of parsed elements.

entries.name: _parse(string[, comp=true])  →  hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Parses the given representation of date and time, and returns a hash of parsed elements.  This method does not function as a validator.

entries.name: _rfc2822(string)  →  hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a hash of parsed elements.

entries.name: _rfc3339(string)  →  hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a hash of parsed elements.

entries.name: _rfc822(string)   →  hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a hash of parsed elements.

entries.name: _strptime(string[, format='%F'])  →  hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Parses the given representation of date and time with the given template, and returns a hash of parsed elements.  _strptime does not support specification of flags and width unlike strftime.

entries.name: _xmlschema(string)  →  hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a hash of parsed elements.

entries.name: civil([year=-4712[, month=1[, mday=1[, start=Date::ITALY]]]])  →  dateclick to toggle source
commercial([cwyear=-4712[, cweek=1[, cwday=1[, start=Date::ITALY]]]])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a date object denoting the given week date.

entries.name: gregorian_leap?(year)  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given year is a leap year of the proleptic Gregorian calendar.

entries.name: httpdate(string='Mon, 01 Jan -4712 00:00:00 GMT'[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new Date object by parsing from a string according to some RFC 2616 format.

entries.name: iso8601(string='-4712-01-01'[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new Date object by parsing from a string according to some typical ISO 8601 formats.

entries.name: jd([jd=0[, start=Date::ITALY]])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a date object denoting the given chronological Julian day number.

entries.name: jisx0301(string='-4712-01-01'[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new Date object by parsing from a string according to some typical JIS X 0301 formats.

entries.name: julian_leap?(year)  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given year is a leap year of the proleptic Julian calendar.

entries.name: leap?(year)            →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given year is a leap year of the proleptic Gregorian calendar.

entries.name: nth_kday(p1 = v1, p2 = v2, p3 = v3, p4 = v4, p5 = v5)
ordinal([year=-4712[, yday=1[, start=Date::ITALY]]])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a date object denoting the given ordinal date.

entries.name: parse(string='-4712-01-01'[, comp=true[, start=Date::ITALY]])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Parses the given representation of date and time, and creates a date object.  This method does not function as a validator.

entries.name: rfc2822(string='Mon, 1 Jan -4712 00:00:00 +0000'[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new Date object by parsing from a string according to some typical RFC 2822 formats.

entries.name: rfc3339(string='-4712-01-01T00:00:00+00:00'[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new Date object by parsing from a string according to some typical RFC 3339 formats.

entries.name: rfc822(string='Mon, 1 Jan -4712 00:00:00 +0000'[, start=Date::ITALY])   →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new Date object by parsing from a string according to some typical RFC 2822 formats.

entries.name: strptime([string='-4712-01-01'[, format='%F'[, start=Date::ITALY]]])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Parses the given representation of date and time with the given template, and creates a date object.  strptime does not support specification of flags and width unlike strftime.

entries.name: today([start=Date::ITALY])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a date object denoting the present day.

entries.name: valid_civil?(year, month, mday[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given calendar date is valid, and false if not. Valid in this context is whether the arguments passed to this method would be accepted by ::new.

entries.name: valid_commercial?(cwyear, cweek, cwday[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given week date is valid, and false if not.

entries.name: valid_date?(year, month, mday[, start=Date::ITALY])   →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given calendar date is valid, and false if not. Valid in this context is whether the arguments passed to this method would be accepted by ::new.

entries.name: valid_jd?(jd[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Just returns true.  It's nonsense, but is for symmetry.

entries.name: valid_ordinal?(year, yday[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the given ordinal date is valid, and false if not.

entries.name: weeknum(p1 = v1, p2 = v2, p3 = v3, p4 = v4, p5 = v5)
xmlschema(string='-4712-01-01'[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new Date object by parsing from a string according to some typical XML Schema formats.

entries.name: d + other  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a date object pointing other days after self.  The other should be a numeric value.  If the other is a fractional number, assumes its precision is at most nanosecond.

entries.name: d - other  →  date or rationalclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the difference between the two dates if the other is a date object. If the other is a numeric value, returns a date object pointing other days before self.  If the other is a fractional number, assumes its precision is at most nanosecond.

entries.name: d << n  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a date object pointing n months before self. The argument n should be a numeric value.

entries.name: d <=> other  → -1, 0, +1 or nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Compares the two dates and returns -1, zero, 1 or nil.  The other should be a date object or a numeric value as an astronomical Julian day number.

entries.name: d === other  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if they are the same day.

entries.name: d >> n  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a date object pointing n months after self. The argument n should be a numeric value.

entries.name: ajd  →  rationalclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the astronomical Julian day number.  This is a fractional number, which is not adjusted by the offset.

entries.name: amjd  →  rationalclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the astronomical modified Julian day number.  This is a fractional number, which is not adjusted by the offset.

entries.name: asctime  →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a string in asctime(3) format (but without “n0” at the end).  This method is equivalent to strftime('%c').

entries.name: ctime    →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a string in asctime(3) format (but without “n0” at the end).  This method is equivalent to strftime('%c').

entries.name: cwday  →  fixnumclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the day of calendar week (1-7, Monday is 1).

entries.name: cweek  →  fixnumclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the calendar week number (1-53).

entries.name: cwyear  →  integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the calendar week based year.

entries.name: day   →  fixnumclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the day of the month (1-31).

entries.name: day_fraction  →  rationalclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the fractional part of the day.

entries.name: england  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to #new_start(Date::ENGLAND).

entries.name: friday?  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the date is Friday.

entries.name: gregorian  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to #new_start(Date::GREGORIAN).

entries.name: gregorian?  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the date is on or after the day of calendar reform.

entries.name: httpdate  →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to strftime('%a, %d %b %Y %T GMT'). See also RFC 2616.

entries.name: inspect  →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the value as a string for inspection.

entries.name: italy  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to #new_start(Date::ITALY).

entries.name: jd  →  integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the Julian day number.  This is a whole number, which is adjusted by the offset as the local time.

entries.name: jisx0301  →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a string in a JIS X 0301 format.

entries.name: julian  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to #new_start(Date::JULIAN).

entries.name: julian?  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the date is before the day of calendar reform.

entries.name: ld  →  integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the Lilian day number.  This is a whole number, which is adjusted by the offset as the local time.

entries.name: leap?  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the year is a leap year.

entries.name: mday  →  fixnumclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the day of the month (1-31).

entries.name: mjd  →  integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the modified Julian day number.  This is a whole number, which is adjusted by the offset as the local time.

entries.name: monday?  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the date is Monday.

entries.name: month  →  fixnumclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the month (1-12).

entries.name: new_start([start=Date::ITALY])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Duplicates self and resets its day of calendar reform.

entries.name: next  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a date object denoting the following day.

entries.name: next_day([n=1])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to d + n.

entries.name: next_month([n=1])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to d >> n.

entries.name: next_year([n=1])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to d >> (n * 12).

entries.name: prev_day([n=1])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to d - n.

entries.name: prev_month([n=1])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to d << n.

entries.name: prev_year([n=1])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to d << (n * 12).

entries.name: rfc3339  →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to strftime('%FT%T%:z').

entries.name: saturday?  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the date is Saturday.

entries.name: start  →  floatclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the Julian day number denoting the day of calendar reform.

entries.name: step(limit[, step=1])              →  enumeratorclick to toggle source
strftime([format='%F'])  →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Formats date according to the directives in the given format string. The directives begin with a percent (%) character. Any text not listed as a directive will be passed through to the output string.

entries.name: succ  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a date object denoting the following day.

entries.name: sunday?  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the date is Sunday.

entries.name: thursday?  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the date is Thursday.

entries.name: to_date  →  selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns self.

entries.name: to_datetime  → datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a DateTime object which denotes self.

entries.name: to_s  →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a string in an ISO 8601 format. (This method doesn't use the expanded representations.)

entries.name: to_time  →  timeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a Time object which denotes self. If self is a julian date, convert it to a gregorian date before converting it to Time.

entries.name: tuesday?  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the date is Tuesday.

entries.name: wday  →  fixnumclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the day of week (0-6, Sunday is zero).

entries.name: wednesday?  →  boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the date is Wednesday.

entries.name: yday  →  fixnumclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the day of the year (1-366).

entries.name: year  →  integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the year.
